title: Tuna Melts
summary: Tuna Melts is a pescatarian recipe with 15 servings. This main course has 186 calories, 14g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. For 49 cents per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of celery, sandwich bread, onion, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the pepper you could follow this main course with the Easy Peppermint Dessert as a dessert. This recipe from Williams Sonoma has 25 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 10 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 54%, this dish is solid. Try Fon-Tuna Melts, Tuna Melts, and My Take on Tuna Melts for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is GEN5 Merlot. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 12 dollars.
